intro: Aethionema retsina, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of white hair. Aethionema retsina is often found in coastal areas and is well adapted to harsh, saline environments.
